Class MainActivity

    public class MainActivity
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
implements ClickListener
    Main Activity for the app. Display's the user's schedule of Tasks/Events, while allowing for Task completion/addition (with the latter done through the use of a separate AddItem activity).
    Author:
    Evan Voogd

    • Method Detail

      • onActivityResult

        protected void onActivityResult​(int resultCode,
                                @Nullable
                                Intent data)
        Handles activities started for a result, in this case when the AddItem activity returns with a new Event/Task to be added. Parses the data in the BundleExtra AddItem.EXTRA_ITEM into a Task/Event depending on their AddItem.EXTRA_TYPE.
        Parameters:
        resultCode - RESULT_OK if there were no issues with user input
        data - Contains the BundleExtra AddItem.EXTRA_ITEM, with all the data needed to build the item.

      • Optimize

        private void Optimize()
        Calls the Optimizer to find an optimal schedule for the user's tasks, given the user's scheduled events.

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate​(Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Runs on the start of the app. Most importantly it loads the user data from the file.
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - Not used.

      • finishProcessing

        private void finishProcessing​(boolean reoptimize)
        Now that the user has handled overdue tasks, we're ready to start the app. This function adds data to the recycler and moves to the working fragment.
        Parameters:
        reoptimize - If the task list has changed due to overdue tasks, we might have to reoptimize it

      • onPause

        protected void onPause()
        Updates todayTime in SharedPreferences
        Overrides:
        onPause in class androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity

      • intentAddItem

        private void intentAddItem()
        Launches the AddItem activity. Must be separate function so FAB handler can call it.

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu​(@NonNull
                                   Menu menu)
        Adds the items to the three dot menu in the ActionBar. Left to defaults for now.
        Parameters:
        menu - The menu in the top right of the screen
        Returns:
        always true

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected​(MenuItem item)
        Handles action bar clicks. Left to defaults for now
        Parameters:
        item - The MenuItem selected
        Returns:
        true in virtually every scenario

      • onButtonClick

        public void onButtonClick​(int position,
                          int day,
                          int action)
        Handles one of the buttons being clicked to complete a task. Weird structure where it's called by the DayItemHolder for the day associated with the task, which in turn is called by the TaskItemHolder for the task.
        Specified by:
        onButtonClick in interface ClickListener
        Parameters:
        position - The index into the taskSchedule.get(day) ArrayList where the task is stored
        day - The date this task is scheduled for is day days past today's date
        action - 0: complete task, 1: delete task, 2: delete event
